title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.18 | 15-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: ओम अज्ञानति मिरान्धस्य ज्ञानान्जुनिषलाकया चक्षुरुन्मीलितं येनातस्मै श्री गुरवे नमः
नमा ओम विष्णु पादाया कृष्ण प्रेष्ठाय भूतले श्री मते भक्ति वेदान्त स्वामिन्निति नामिने
नमस्ते सारस्वते देवे गौरभाणी प्रचारिने निर्विशेशा शुन्यवादी पाश्चात्यदेशतारिने जय श्री कृष्ण चैतन्या प्रभूरित्यानन्दा
श्री अद्वैत गदाधरः श्रीवासाधी गौरभक्त वृण्धा हरे कृष्णा हरे कृष्णा कृष्टकृष्णा हरे हरे हरे राम हरे रामा रामरामा हरे हरे
ओम् नमो भगवते वासुदेवाया नारायणम् नमस्कृत्या नरम्चेवनरोत्तमं देवीम् सरस्वतीम् व्यासम् ततो जयम् उदीरयेत्
In this session we will be discussing from the 18th verse of the 9th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
एशवै भगवान साक्षाद आध्यो नारायण फुमान
मोहयन मायया लोकम
गूडश्चरति वृष्णिशूम्
The meaning of this verse
This Shri Krishna is no other than the inconceivable original personality of Godhead.
He is the first Narayana, the supreme enjoyer.
But he is moving amongst the descendants of King Vrishni just like one of us.
And he is bewilderingly
bewildering us with his self-created energy.
This verse is spoken by Bhishma Deva.
He is addressing the Pandavas and all the assembled sages.
Bhishma Deva is revealing the identity of Shri Krishna.
Shri Krishna appeared as one of the members of the Vrishni dynasty.
Vasudeva, the father of Krishna, belonged to the Vrishni dynasty, descendant of King Vrishni.
So Krishna appeared as the son of Vasudeva.
In that dynasty, he is counted among the members of the Vrishni dynasty.
So even though he is moving amongst the descendants of the Vrishni dynasty as one of them,
he is actually the supreme personality of Godhead.
He is not another living being.
So who can recognize this?
Only the pure devotees can recognize Krishna.
Only the pure devotees can recognize Krishna.
Others cannot.
So therefore,
Bhishma Deva is revealing,
Krishna is the original personality of Godhead.
Srila Prabhupada explains this in the purport very nicely.
Srila Prabhupada says,
The Vedic system of acquiring knowledge is the deductive process.
What is the meaning of deductive process?
It descends or comes down from Krishna to Brahma to Narada to Vyasa.
Successively, the knowledge is handed down.
Without any change.
As it is.
Without any change, the knowledge is handed down.
This is the deductive process.
As opposed to this, there is the ascending process.
Ascending process is the method of currently we know something by our own efforts.
As opposed to this, there is the ascending process.
As opposed to this, there is the ascending process.
As opposed to this, there is the ascending process.
By our own efforts,
collective efforts, individual and collective efforts,
we have done some amount of research in science.
We know something.
But further on they keep doing more research,
and they add to the knowledge base.
and they add to the knowledge base.
So this is the ascending process,
going from the known to the unknown,
little by little,
little by little by little by little by little but the process is fraught with
so many problems so many problems so those problems are not there in the
Vedic system of deductive process a descending process the perfect complete
knowledge is given by Krishna the source of all knowledge the all-knowing Supreme
Personality Buddha Krishna he gives that knowledge to Brahma the first created
being in the whole universe whole creation and Brahma receives that
knowledge and he hands down that knowledge to his sons and disciples so
it is perfect knowledge it is complete knowledge and it is properly transmitted
and received without any change without any
speculation
without any errors without any additions or subtractions without any of
those so that is the Vedic system so Srila Prabhupada says further the Vedic
knowledge is received perfectly by discipline succession from authorities
discipline succession means guru to disciple then the disciple to his
disciple he becomes the next guru and he hands over to his disciple that's called
the discipline succession

just because they are rejecting the authority of the Vedas now Prabhupada says here is an authority
speaking about Shri Krishna as the original personality of Godhead and the first Narayana
Bhishma Deva is an authority even such an impersonalist as Acharya Shankara has said in
the beginning of his commentation on the Bhagavad Gita that Narayana the personality of Godhead is
beyond the material creation
Narayana Paro unavyaktat
this is the Bhagavad Gita BASSHA
by Shankaracharya
the universe is one of the material creations but Narayana is transcendental to such material
paraphernalia this is what told by Shankaracharyam now about Bhishma Deva
Bhishma Deva, Prabhupada says Bhishma Deva is one of the twelve Mahajanas who knows the principles of transcendental knowledge.
These twelve Mahajanas are mentioned in the Srimad Bhagavatam.
So Bhishma Deva is one of them.
His confirmation of Lord Shri Krishna's being the original personality of Godhead is also corroborated by the impersonalist Shankara.
All other Acharyas have also confirmed this statement and thus there is no chance of not accepting Lord Shri Krishna as the original personality of Godhead.
So Bhishma Deva is one of the twelve Mahajanas.
He is declaring Krishna to be the supreme personality of Godhead.
Shankara Acharya is one of the Acharyas about who is explained the Vedic texts.
And he accepts Krishna as the supreme personality of Godhead.
The other Acharyas, Madhavacharya, Ramanujacharya, Lord Chaitanya, so many Acharyas, they have all accepted.
They are confirming.
So there is no question of not accepting Krishna as the supreme personality of Godhead.
And even Brahma has confirmed this in the Bhagavatam.
In the 10th canto 14th chapter 14th verse.
So Krishna is the first Narayana.
In the spiritual world, what is the meaning of first Narayana?
Prabhupada explains this.
In the spiritual world, there are unlimited number of Narayanas who are all the same personality of Godhead and are considered to be plenary expansions of the original personality of Godhead Krishna.
Krishna expands as Balarama. Balarama expands as Sankarsana.
Sankarsana expands as Narayana.
So there are many Narayana forms, each Vaikuntha planet having one form of Narayana.
There are unlimited Vaikuntha planets, unlimited forms of Narayana predominating each Vaikuntha planet.
So this is the explanation given in the Bhagavatam, in the Vedas, in the Upanishads.
So this is very very clear, perfect knowledge.

But it has to be accepted based on the authority of Bhishma Deva, based on the authority of Shankaracharya, based on the authority of the other Acharyas, based on the authority of Brahma, Narada, Vyasa.
So this is the way of receiving transcendental knowledge.
That is the conclusion.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
